definitions.definition: to punish somebody for breaking a rule or law by making them suffer a disadvantage

examples.text: You will be penalized for poor spelling.
Students will be penalized for mistakes in spelling and grammar.
The law is designed to reward those who conserve and penalize those who pollute.

definitions.definition: to punish somebody for breaking a rule in a sport or game by giving an advantage to their opponent

examples.text: Foul play will be severely penalized.

definitions.definition: to put somebody at a disadvantage by treating them unfairly

examples.text: The new law appears to penalize the poorest members of society.
He felt penalized because of his age.
He claims that he was unfairly penalized.
It is wrong for women to be financially penalized when they have children.
Under the tax, each adult in the household had to pay, which penalized larger families.
Will he be penalized for absence due to ill health?
